alert.note: Alert for Chemung; Chenango; Cortland; Madison; Otsego; Schuyler; Southern Oneida; Steuben; Tompkins (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 17 at 9:21PM EST until December 19 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of central New York, including the following counties, Broome, Chemung, Chenango, Cortland, Delaware, Madison, Oneida, Otsego, Schuyler, Steuben, Sullivan, Tioga and Tompkins and northeast Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Bradford, Lackawanna, Luzerne, Pike, Wayne, Susquehanna and Wyoming. * WHEN...Through late Monday night. The heaviest rainfall will be tonight into Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A widespread 1 to 3 inches of rain is likely across the area. Even higher amounts are possible in the western Catskills of NY and parts of northeast PA. This area has the highest chance of flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Chemung; Chenango; Cortland; Madison; Otsego; Schuyler; Southern Oneida; Steuben; Tompkins
